metadata.title: Diversification matters
metadata.description: Diversification means "not putting all your eggs into one basket": if you invest in a single stock or one sector only, you risk great losses if that stock or sector doesn't develop well. So you should generally aim for a diverse portfolio

dialogs: Buy the stocks you think will develop best over the next 14 months!
Surprisingly, Apple performed badly over this time frame. Some lucky investors gained a lot from Microsoft.
A balanced investor might have achieved earnings of 4%, performing much better than those who only bough Apple stock
